title: Usain Bolt reveals one reason he d run at 2020 Olympics - Yahoo7
text:
Bolt reveals only reason he'd run at 2020 Olympics NBC Sports via Yahoo Sports - 7Sport on February 28, 2017, 5:18 pm Share Usain Bolt reveals one reason he d run at 2020 Olympics - Yahoo7 Usain Bolt is happily retired, but the eight-time gold medallist says one thing would have made him consider trying for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Close Bolt loses triple treble after Carter ban UP NEXT VIDEO Bolt loses triple treble after Carter ban. Source: 7News Bolt loses triple treble after Carter ban 
If Bolt had lost his 2008 Olympic relay medal before the Rio Games, instead of last month, maybe he would have considered it. 
"Maybe if it had come before the Olympics, maybe it would have taken away a little from me, and then I would have thought about [2020]," Bolt said in a CNN interview published on Tuesday of dropping from nine Olympic golds to eight due to teammate Nesta Carter‘s doping. 
"But the fact that I got the chance to say, 'the triple-triple'’ kind of made me feel good." Bolt in Rio. Image: Getty 
In Rio, Bolt completed his 'triple-triple' at his final Olympics, sweeping the 100m, 200m and 4x100m titles at a third straight Games. 
Bolt raced with the knowledge that Carter had failed retests of 2008 Olympic samples but had yet to receive any punishment. 
Five months later, the triple-triple was no more. 
On Januray 25, the IOC announced Carter was retroactively disqualified from the Beijing Games. Close Bolt helps All-Stars claim overall victrory UP NEXT VIDEO Bolt helps All-Stars claim overall victrory. Source: Channel 7 Bolt helps All-Stars claim overall victrory 
Carter was on Jamaica's 4x100m relay team in Beijing, so the entire team was stripped of medals, including Bolt. 
Carter also joined Bolt on gold-medal-winning 4x100m relays at the 2012 Olympics and the world championships in 2011, 2013 and 2015. Carter was not disqualified from those meets like he was the 2008 Beijing Games. 
Bolt said he had no fear or worry about the possibility of having to return more relay gold medals. 
"Even if I lose all my relay gold medals, for me, I did what I had to do, my personal goals," Bolt said in the CNN interview that appeared to take place two weeks ago in Monaco. "That's what counts." Close Bolt cruises to victory in 150m UP NEXT VIDEO Bolt cruises to victory in 150m. Source: Channel 7 Bolt cruises to victory in 150m 
Bolt also said he had not spoken to Carter since the ruling was handed down. 
"My friends have asked me what I'm going to say [to Carter], but I don’t know," Bolt said, repeating that he had no hard feelings toward Carter. 
Bolt's next scheduled meet is the Racers Grand Prix in Kingston on June 10, but he could (and likely will given his past) sign up for another race between now and then. Close Rio stars dominate world sport awards UP NEXT
